references.paper_title: Human-level control through deep reinforcement learning
references.reason: This foundational paper demonstrates the capability of deep reinforcement learning to achieve human-level performance in complex tasks, providing a key context for the advancements explored in the current research.

references.paper_title: Mastering the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search
references.reason: This groundbreaking paper showcases the success of deep reinforcement learning in mastering the game of Go, highlighting the potential of RL in complex strategic domains and thus setting the stage for more sophisticated RL challenges.

references.paper_title: Emergent complexity and zero-shot transfer via unsupervised environment design
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduces the concept of unsupervised environment design (UED), which directly addresses the generalization challenge in RL and serves as the primary inspiration for the current research.

This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models, which provide a powerful and versatile generative modeling framework leveraged in the current research for creating diverse and challenging training environments.

This paper proposes a significant improvement on UED, employing replay-based methods to address the instability and inefficiency issues of the original UED approach, which the current research also improves upon.
